resources.string:
Use the menu to set the display unit, precision, rounding mode and display options.

Automatic mode displays decimal results by default for Metric measurements and fractions for Imperial measurements.

Enter measurements, such as 5.5 or 5 1/2 and a unit, such as yards or meters.

Add, subtract, multiply and divide the entered measurements.

Measurement conversions are handled automatically and stored internally at the maximum rational precision.

The result will be displayed in the specified display unit rounded to the specified precision when you press the equal button.

For instance, to solve 10 3/8 m + 60.2 ft, press 1, 0, >>, 3, /, 8, Unit of Measurement, Meters, +, 6, 0, ., 2, Unit of Measurement, Feet, =.

To convert the current measurement, click Convert and select the desired unit.
To convert a measurement, a unit must be specified.
A quantity can not be divided by a unit measurement.
A unit measurement can not be multiplied by a unit measurement yet. Use a quantity instead.

v.1.0.8
Changed default Display Unit to FT/IN.

v.1.0.7
Cleaned up dialogs and removed ft/in from Unit of Measurement dialog.

v.1.0.6
Fixed bug with decimal point to correctly recognize formats .XX and X.XX as valid expressions.

v.1.0.5
Added Foot/Inch mode. To activate Foot/Inch mode, touch Settings - Display Unit - Foot/Inch.

If you have any problems, please leave a comment at rationalcalc.com with any calculation that returns an incorrect result.

Thanks for using RationalCalc!

v.1.0.4
Increased the font size for improved legibility.

v.1.0.3
Added display options menu preference for selecting whether to show results as fraction or decimal.

Automatic mode displays decimal results by default for Metric measurements and fractions for Imperial measurements.

Fractional always displays results as fractions.

Decimal always displays results as decimals.

v.1.0.2
Upgraded apache-commons-math to v. 2.1 to fix the bug: "When multiplying two BigFraction objects with numerators larger than will fit in an java-primitive int the result of BigFraction.ZERO is incorrectly returned."

v 1.0.0:
Initial release

v.1.0.8
Changed default Display Unit to FT/IN.

v.1.0.7
Cleaned up dialogs and removed ft/in from Unit of Measurement dialog.

v.1.0.6
Fixed bug with decimal point to correctly recognize formats .XX and X.XX as valid expressions.

v.1.0.5
Added Foot/Inch mode. To activate Foot/Inch mode, touch Settings - Display Unit - Foot/Inch.

If you have any problems, please leave a comment at rationalcalc.com with any calculation that returns an incorrect result.

Thanks for using RationalCalc!
Calculates length with automatic unit conversions and rounds the results to nearest common fractions.
Please email your suggestions and comments to:\n\ntimothyleerussell@gmail.com
A unit measurement can not be divided by a unit measurement yet. Use a quantity instead.
